publish:property.name: Qualified Name
publish:property.publish:value: SID Models::Product Domain::Loyalty ABE::_Loyalty Addendum Figures

contents.name: Figure Pr.37 - Loyalty Program main view
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Product Domain::Loyalty ABE::_Loyalty Addendum Figures::Figure Pr.37 - Loyalty Program main view

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: A loyalty program is one of the tools used by the loyalty process to retain customers. For example, another tool is the ProductOffering Commitment....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Pr.37 - Loyalty Program main view

ownedComment.body:
A loyalty program is one of the tools used by the loyalty process to retain customers. For example, another tool is the ProductOffering Commitment.
An example of loyalty program could be « Change Your Mobile Offer »: • available only for prepaid contracts, therefore incompatible with postpaid contracts, • month after month the customer earns points and depending on the number of points he has, he can buy a new handset at a lower price using his points. Another example could be a “more time for calls” program that gives you more time for calls according to your seniority (i.e.: 5% after six months of seniority, 10% after two years of seniority, etc.). And these two loyalty programs could have a cost and be incompatible. The aim of marketing is to find levers in the form of rewards to enhance customer loyalty to its operator. Most of the time, the conditions to reward a customer are based on • seniority in customer relationship, • the importance of revenue from the customer, • or the risk of churn. The more the customer remains with the operator or consumes, the more he will be rewarded.
Different types of rewards can be considered: • physical rewards: accessories, terminals, points usable to buy accessories / terminals ... • virtual rewards: free usage, vouchers ... The rewards that can be bought thanks to loyalty earns correspond to ProductSpecification & ProductOffering with a price allowing a specific currency (loyalty points). A loyalty program is a part of a contract and may be either mandatory or not (packaging rule, pre-requisite). As a loyalty program represents a cost for the operator, the latter avoids that the customer may have several loyalty programs. To do so, Loyalty Programs might be incompatible with each other and in this case the customer has to choose only one LoyaltyProgram. Therefore, a loyalty program is a type of AtomicProductSpecification, is packaged through ProductOffering and is instantiated in the same manner in the installed base (LoyaltyProgramProduct that is a type of ProductComponent). A LoyaltyProgramProdSpec defines the LoyaltyRules that have to be checked in order to identify the actions to apply. A LoyaltyRule is a type of PolicyRule. Depending on the type of LoyaltyRules a LoyaltyAccount might be needed to collect gains or not. This is defined by the needsLoyaltyAccount attribute on the LoyaltyProgramProdSpec entity.

contents.name: Figure Pr.38 - Loyalty Rule
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Product Domain::Loyalty ABE::_Loyalty Addendum Figures::Figure Pr.38 - Loyalty Rule

ownedComment.body:
A LoyaltyRule specifies: • Events triggering the evaluation of the rule (LoyaltyEvent) • Ex: Every first of a month, a CustomerOrder of Top-Up • Conditions that have to be checked (LoyaltyCondition) • Ex: If the invoice amount is above 100 €, If more than 2 hours of international call • Actions that should be performed if the condition clause is evaluated to TRUE (LoyaltyAction) • Ex: Give 50 SMS free, Credit 10 points on the LoyaltyAccount
Loyalty Rules may result in • either rewards directly used / usable by the customer • Ex: 5% more time on the communications package after 6 months of age, and 10% after one year ... • or loyalty earn that are gathered on an account to be used to pay later a ProductOffering • Ex: 400 points to welcome a subscription then 10 points for every Euro charged. The points collected can be used to buy rewards like a USB stick, 100 SMS… The different types of LoyaltyEvent may be event that occurs on BillingAccount (Ex: amount of Invoice, recurring charge), on PartyRole (Ex: CustomerOrder amount), on Products (Ex: monthly international usage volume). A LoyaltyAction may correspond either to a CustomerOrder (Ex: 100 SMS free), or to an Interaction (Ex: a SMS notifying the 100 SMS free) or to a LoyaltyEarn (Ex: 100 points on the LoyaltyAccount) Each time a LoyaltyEvent happens, LoyaltyConditions from LoyaltyRules triggered by this type of event are evaluated. If the result is true, a LoyaltyExecutionPoint is noted tracking the application of the rule and triggering BusinessInteraction, CustomerOrder or LoyaltyEarn. A LoyaltyExecutionPoint is a type of PolicyExecutionPoint.
Depending on event’s type used in LoyaltyRule, the LoyaltyProgramProduct will specify entities from which it computes events (BillingAccount, Product…). The way to specify these boundaries from which loyalty events are collected to calculate the gains is not yet represented in this diagram and needs to be further studied.

contents.name: Figure Pr.39 - Loyalty Account
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Product Domain::Loyalty ABE::_Loyalty Addendum Figures::Figure Pr.39 - Loyalty Account

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: A LoyaltyAccount corresponds to a set of balances to carry loyalty movement according to different valid period and unit....

ownedComment.body: A LoyaltyAccount corresponds to a set of balances to carry loyalty movement according to different valid period and unit. A LoyaltyAccount may be required to realize a LoyaltyProgramProduct according to the rules carried by the corresponding LoyaltyProgramProdSpec. A LoyaltyAccount may collect results from one or more LoyaltyProgramProduct. A LoyaltyProgramMember is defined on each LoyaltyAccount. A LoyaltyProgramMember is a type of PartyRole and is granted with the rights on the LoyaltyAccount such as to execute LoyaltyBurn used to realize a CustomerPayment. Each LoyaltyBalance gathers LoyaltyEarns and LoyaltyBurns.

contents.name: Figure Pr.40a - Payment Method and Plan
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Product Domain::Loyalty ABE::_Loyalty Addendum Figures::Figure Pr.40a - Payment Method and Plan

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: The means of payment is classified by PaymentMethod....

publish:property.name: Name
publish:property.publish:value: Figure Pr.40a - Payment Method and Plan

ownedComment.body: The means of payment is classified by PaymentMethod. For example, payment by cash, check, bank card (credit card or debit card), third party (like bank transfer, payment tool), account balance and loyalty burn. The LoyaltyBurnPM is a type of PaymentMethod that uses a LoyaltyAccount.
